qas.question: Was Texas a part of Mexico?

answers.text: In 1821, after Mexico's War of Independence from Spain, Texas was part of the United Mexican States as the state of Coahuila y Tejas

qas.question: When did the Americans come to Texas?

answers.text: A large influx of Americans soon followed, originally with the approval of Mexico's president. In 1836

qas.question: Was there a war between the Mexicans and the Texans?

answers.text: Texans, fought a war of independence from the central government of Mexico

qas.question: When did Texas become a state?

answers.text: In 1846, the Republic dissolved when Texas entered the United States of America as a state.

qas.question: Was Texas a primarily a Spanish speaking state?

answers.text: Per the 1850 U.S. census, fewer than 16,000 Texans were of Mexican descent, and nearly all were Spanish-speaking people

context: <a0_0>In <b10_0>1821<b10_0/>, after Mexico's War of Independence from Spain, Texas was part of the <b5_0>United Mexican States<b5_0/> as the state of Coahuila y Tejas<a0_0/>. <a1_0>A large influx of Americans soon followed, originally with the approval of Mexico's president. In <b11_0>1836<b11_0/><a1_0/>, the now largely "American" <a2_0>Texans, fought a war of independence from the central government of <b13_0>Mexico<b13_0/><a2_0/> and established the Republic of Texas. <a3_0>In <b9_0>1846<b9_0/>, the Republic dissolved when Texas entered the United States of America as a state.<a3_0/> <a4_0>Per the <b14_0>1850 U.S. census<b14_0/>, <b12_0>fewer than <b6_0>16,000<b12_0/><b6_0/> Texans were of Mexican descent, and <b7_0>nearly all<b7_0/> were Spanish-speaking people<a4_0/> (both Mexicans and non-Spanish European settlers who include <b8_0>German<b8_0/> Texan) who were outnumbered (six-to-one) by English-speaking settlers (both Americans and other immigrant Europeans).[citation needed]
